# `$ gif-cli` [![Donate now][donate-now]][paypal-donations]

Gif animations in your terminal!

## Installation

```sh
$ npm i gif-cli
```

### CLI Usage
You can install the package globally and use it as command line tool:

```sh
$ npm i -g gif-cli
```

Then, run `gif-cli --help` and see what the cli tool can do.

## Example

Here is an example how to use this package as library.

```js
// Dependencies
var GifCli = require("gif-cli")
  , CliFrames = require("cli-frames")
  ;

// Convert the gif file into text frames
GifCli(__dirname + "/nyantocat.gif", function (err, frames) {
    if (err) { return Logger.log(err, "error"); }

    // Show the animation
    var animation = new CliFrames();
    animation.load(frames);
    animation.start({
        repeat: true
      , delay: 50
    });
});

```

For full API reference, see the [DOCUMENTATION.md][docs] file.
